description: Use of firewalls to secure Internet connections.
questions: Do you have a firewall on all internet connections?
Are default passwords on firewalls changed to strong, unique passwords?

description: Secure configuration of devices and software.
questions: Are all unnecessary user accounts and services disabled?
Do you change default passwords and settings on all devices?

description: User access control and privilege management.
questions: Do you operate on the principle of least privilege for user accounts?
Are administrator accounts only used when necessary?

description: Use of up-to-date malware protection.
questions: Do you use anti-virus or endpoint protection software on all devices?
Are malware definitions and security patches updated automatically?

description: Patch management and software updates.
questions: Are all critical updates applied within 14 days?
Do you have an automated patch management system?

description: Organizations should have an approved information security policy that is reviewed regularly.
questions: Do you have a documented information security policy?
When was the policy last reviewed or updated?

description: Roles and responsibilities for information security must be clearly defined.
questions: Are roles and responsibilities formally assigned?
How do you ensure employees understand their security responsibilities?

description: Implement a policy for the secure use of mobile devices.
questions: Do you enforce a mobile device management (MDM) policy?
Are devices encrypted and secured with passwords or biometrics?

description: Employees should receive appropriate training on security policies.
questions: How often do you run security awareness training?
Do you track completion of training by all employees?

description: Maintain an inventory of all critical assets.
questions: Do you maintain an up-to-date inventory of IT assets?
Who is responsible for asset management?

description: Information must be classified according to sensitivity.
questions: Do you label documents based on sensitivity (e.g., Confidential)?
Do staff receive training on data classification?

description: Access rights should be granted based on the principle of least privilege.
questions: Is there a documented access control policy?
How often do you review user permissions?

description: Formal processes for creating, changing, and deleting user accounts.
questions: Do you have a defined process for user account lifecycle management?
How quickly are inactive accounts removed?

description: Changes to systems must be managed through a formal change control process.
questions: Do you use a ticketing or approval system for changes?
Are all changes logged and reviewed?

description: User and system activities must be logged and monitored.
questions: Do you have centralized logging for all critical systems?
Are logs reviewed for suspicious activity?

description: Network controls should protect information in networks and supporting systems.
questions: Do you have firewalls or IDS/IPS systems in place?
Is network segmentation implemented where needed?

description: Controls should be in place to protect information in electronic messaging.
questions: Are emails encrypted when containing sensitive data?
Do you use spam and phishing filters?

description: Establish and apply security principles for software development.
questions: Do developers follow secure coding guidelines?
Is code reviewed for security vulnerabilities?

description: Information security requirements should be addressed in supplier agreements.
questions: Do you assess supplier security before contracting?
Are security clauses included in all vendor agreements?

description: Establish a process for managing information security incidents.
questions: Do you have an incident response plan?
When was the last incident drill performed?

description: The organization must determine requirements for information security during disruptions.
questions: Do you have a tested disaster recovery plan?
How often is the business continuity plan updated?

description: Identify and document all relevant legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements.
questions: Do you maintain a compliance register?
How do you track changes in relevant legislation?

description: Ensure compliance with intellectual property rights and licensing.
questions: Are all software licenses documented?
How do you verify compliance with IPR laws?

description: Ensure compliance with data protection laws like GDPR.
questions: Do you have a data privacy policy?
Do you perform regular data protection impact assessments?

description: Conduct regular independent reviews of the ISMS.
questions: When was your last internal or external ISMS audit?
Are audit findings tracked and resolved?
